verses.verse: (For the choir director; on the Gittith. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.) How <S%H4100><s%> lovely <S%H3039><s%> are Thy dwelling <S%H4908><s%> places, <S%H4908><s%> O Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts! <S%H6635><s%>

My soul <S%H5315><s%> longed <S%H3700><s%> and even <S%H1571><s%> yearned <S%H3615><s%> for the courts <S%H2691><s%> of the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> My heart <S%H3820><s%> and my flesh <S%H1320><s%> sing <S%H7442><s%> for joy <S%H7442><s%> to the living <S%H2416><s%> God. <S%H410><s%>

The bird <S%H6833><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> has found <S%H4672><s%> a house, <S%H1004><s%> And the swallow <S%H1866><s%> a nest <S%H7064><s%> for herself, where <S%H834><s%> she may lay <S%H7896><s%> her young, <S%H667><s%> Even Thine altars, <S%H4196><s%> O Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> My King <S%H4428><s%> and my God. <S%H430><s%>
How blessed <S%H835><s%> are those who dwell <S%H3427><s%> in Thy house! <S%H1004><s%> They are ever <S%H5750><s%> praising <S%H1984><s%> Thee. Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
How blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H120><s%> whose strength <S%H5797><s%> is in Thee; In whose heart <S%H3824><s%> are the highways <S%H4546><s%> [to Zion]!

Passing <S%H5674><s%> through the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Baca, <S%H1056><s%> they make <S%H7896><s%> it a spring, <S%H4599><s%> The early <S%H9251><s%> rain <S%H9251><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> covers <S%H5844><s%> it with blessings. <S%H1293><s%>
They go <S%H1980><s%> from strength <S%H2428><s%> to strength, <S%H2428><s%> [Every one of them] appears <S%H7200><s%> before <S%H413><s%> God <S%H430><s%> in Zion. <S%H6726><s%>

O Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer; <S%H8605><s%> Give <S%H238><s%> ear, <S%H238><s%> O God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob! <S%H3290><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Behold <S%H7200><s%> our shield, <S%H4043><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> And look <S%H5027><s%> upon the face <S%H6440><s%> of Thine anointed. <S%H4899><s%>

For a day <S%H3117><s%> in Thy courts <S%H2691><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> [outside.] I would rather stand <S%H5605><s%> at the threshold <S%H5605><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of my God, <S%H430><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> dwell <S%H1752><s%> in the tents <S%H168><s%> of wickedness. <S%H7562><s%>

For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> is a sun <S%H8121><s%> and shield; <S%H4043><s%> The Lord <S%H3068><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> grace <S%H2580><s%> and glory; <S%H9202><s%> No <S%H3808><s%> good <S%H9185><s%> thing <S%H9185><s%> does He withhold <S%H4513><s%> from those who walk <S%H1980><s%> uprightly. <S%H8549><s%>
O Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> How blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H120><s%> who trusts <S%H982><s%> in Thee!
